intro: Echidnopsis sharpei subsp. ciliata, commonly known as the Ciliated Echidnopsis, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy or ciliate margins on the leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. This plant is often cultivated for its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
